text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus nevadensis is a species of mushroom in the family Strophariaceae. The fungus was described as new to science in 1991 by Gastón Guzmán and his daughter Laura Guzmán-Dávalos. The type collection was found in Jalisco, Mexico, where it was fruiting in a cluster on a dead branch in a pine and oak woodland.This species is in the nevadensis-penetrans infrageneric grouping of the genus Gymnopilus.
